intro: Cinchona floribunda, commonly known as the pink cinchona, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and quinine-producing species. The plant is characterized by its striking pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its bark contains compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
